pmdplyr 0.2.1
  • Reference

pibble methods

Source: R/tbl_pb_methods.R
pibble_methods.Rd

These are variants of existing functions that are designed to retain the pibble status of the object, as well as its .i, .t, and .d attributes.

# S3 method for tbl_pb
mutate(.data, ...)

# S3 method for tbl_pb
mutate_all(.tbl, .funs, ...)

# S3 method for tbl_pb
mutate_at(.tbl, .vars, .funs, ..., .cols = NULL)

# S3 method for tbl_pb
mutate_if(.tbl, .predicate, .funs, ...)

# S3 method for tbl_pb
distinct(.data, ..., .keep_all = FALSE)

# S3 method for tbl_pb
group_by(.data, ...)

# S3 method for tbl_pb
group_by_all(.tbl, .funs = list(), ..., .add = FALSE,
  .drop = dplyr::group_by_drop_default(.tbl))

# S3 method for tbl_pb
group_by_all(.tbl, .funs = list(), ..., .add = FALSE,
  .drop = dplyr::group_by_drop_default(.tbl))

# S3 method for tbl_pb
group_by_at(.tbl, .vars, .funs = list(), ...,
  .add = FALSE, .drop = dplyr::group_by_drop_default(.tbl))

# S3 method for tbl_pb
group_by_if(.tbl, .predicate, .funs = list(), ...,
  .add = FALSE, .drop = dplyr::group_by_drop_default(.tbl))

# S3 method for tbl_pb
ungroup(x, ...)

# S3 method for tbl_pb
bind_cols(.data, ...)

# S3 method for tbl_pb
intersect(x, y, ...)

# S3 method for tbl_pb
union(x, y, ...)

# S3 method for tbl_pb
union_all(x, y, ...)

# S3 method for tbl_pb
setdiff(x, y, ...)

# S3 method for tbl_pb
left_join(x, y, by = NULL, copy = FALSE,
  suffix = c(".x", ".y"), ...)

# S3 method for tbl_pb

  suffix = c(".x", ".y"), ...)

# S3 method for tbl_pb

  suffix = c(".x", ".y"), ...)

# S3 method for tbl_pb
full_join(x, y, by = NULL, copy = FALSE,
  suffix = c(".x", ".y"), ...)

# S3 method for tbl_pb
semi_join(x, y, by = NULL, copy = FALSE, ...)

# S3 method for tbl_pb
nest_join(x, y, by = NULL, copy = FALSE,
  keep = FALSE, name = NULL, ...)

# S3 method for tbl_pb
anti_join(x, y, by = NULL, copy = FALSE, ...)

# S3 method for tbl_pb

# S3 method for tbl_pb

# S3 method for tbl_pb
transmute_all(.tbl, .funs, ...)

# S3 method for tbl_pb
transmute_at(.tbl, .vars, .funs, ..., .cols = NULL)

# S3 method for tbl_pb
transmute_if(.tbl, .predicate, .funs, ...)

Arguments

.data, x, .tbl

These functions take a tbl_pb (i.e. pibble) object as input
.add, by, .cols, copy, .drop, .funs, keep, .keep_all, name, .predicate, suffix, .vars, y, ...

Other parameters to be passed to the relevant functions

Details

Some functions that already preserve pibble status and so don't need special methods include:

dplyr::filter, dplyr::filter_all, dplyr::filter_at, dplyr::filter_if, dplyr::arrange, dplyr::arrange_all, dplyr::arrange_at, dplyr::arrange_if, dplyr::sample_frac, dplyr::slice, dplyr::sample_n, dplyr::top_n, dplyr::add_row, tibble:add_column

dplyr::bind_rows is currently not supported.

Any function that takes two data frames/tibbles as inputs will retain the panel structure of the first argument.

If a function is not on the above list or elsewhere in this help file, then you may need to re-as_pibble your object after using the function.
